description:
cmd/gc: remove mentions of "ideal" from error messages.
        _ = complex("foo", 0)
        _ = complex(true, 0)
now trigger:
        x.go:4: invalid operation: complex("foo", 0) (mismatched types untyped string and untyped constant)
        x.go:5: invalid operation: complex(true, 0) (mismatched types untyped bool and untyped constant)

Fixes issue 4521

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

https://codereview.appspot.com/12973043/diff/1/src/cmd/gc/const.c
File src/cmd/gc/const.c (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/12973043/diff/1/src/cmd/gc/const.c#newcode1059
src/cmd/gc/const.c:1059: // but for an arbitrary "ideal" (untyped constant) expression.
it can be untyped as a constant or as a shift

https://codereview.appspot.com/12973043/diff/1/src/cmd/gc/fmt.c
File src/cmd/gc/fmt.c (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/12973043/diff/1/src/cmd/gc/fmt.c#newcode580
src/cmd/gc/fmt.c:580: [TIDEAL]	= "untyped constant",
now for 

func main() {
      s := uint(2)
      _ = complex("foo", 1<<s)
}

it says:
z.go:5: invalid operation: complex("foo", 1 << s) (mismatched types untyped string and untyped constant)

but 1<<s doesn't look like a constant.

Here's what it used to say:

./x.go:11: invalid operation: complex("foo", 1 << s) (mismatched types
ideal string and ideal)

"ideal" is no better than "untyped constant" here. it's the 1 it's
complaining about, not 1<<s.


suggestions welcome. i claim it's no worse than before, and avoids the
bad word, but if you have a better solution i'm happy to try it.

-rob

subject: code review 12973043: cmd/gc: remove mentions of "ideal" from error messages.
